t: Jeremiah 5
Jerusalem’s Godlessness

“Roam*pn to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, And*ln look now and take note. And*ln seek in her open squares, If*ln you can find a man, If*ln there is one who does justice, who seeks truth, Then*ln I will pardon her.
And*ln although they say, ‘As the Lord*s lives,’ Surely*ln they swear falsely.”

O*ln Lord,*s do not Your eyes look*i for truth? You*ln have smitten them, But*iln they did not weaken; You*ln have consumed them, But*ln they refused to take correction. They*ln have made their faces harder than rock; They*ln have refused to repent.
Then*ln I said, “They are only the poor, They*ln are foolish; For*ln they do not know the way of the Lord*s Or*iln the ordinance of their God.

I*ln will go to the great And*ln will speak to them, For*ln they know the way of the Lord*s And*iln the ordinance of their God.” But*ln they too, with one accord, have broken the yoke And*iln burst the bonds.

Therefore*ln a lion from the forest will slay them, A*ln wolf of the deserts will destroy them, A*ln leopard is watching their cities. Everyone*ln who goes out of them will be torn in pieces, Because*ln their transgressions are many, Their*ln apostasies are numerous.
“Why*ln should I pardon you? Your*ln sons have forsaken Me And*ln sworn by those who are not gods. When*ln I had fed them to the full, They*ln committed adultery And*ln trooped to the harlot’s house.
They*ln were well-fed lusty horses, Each*ln one neighing after his neighbor’s wife.
Shall*ln I not punish these people,”*i declares the Lord,*s “And*ln on a nation such as this Shall*ln I not avenge Myself?
“Go*ln up through her vine rows and destroy, But*ln do not execute a complete destruction; Strip*ln away her branches, For*ln they are not the Lord’s.*s
For*ln the house of Israel and the house of Judah Have*ln dealt very treacherously with Me,” declares the Lord.*s
They*ln have lied about the Lord*s And*ln said, “Not He; Misfortune*ln will not come on us, And*ln we will not see sword or famine.
The*ln prophets are as*i wind, And*ln the word is not in them. Thus*ln it will be done to them!”
Judgment Proclaimed
Therefore,*pn thus says the Lord,*s the God of hosts, “Because*ln you have spoken this word, Behold,*ln I am making My words in your mouth fire And*ln this people wood, and it will consume them.

Behold,*ln I am bringing a nation against you from afar, O house of Israel,” declares the Lord.*s “It*ln is an enduring nation, It*ln is an ancient nation, A*ln nation whose language you do not know, Nor*ln can you understand what they say.
Their*ln quiver is like an open grave, All*ln of them are mighty men.

They*ln will devour your harvest and your food; They*ln will devour your sons and your daughters; They*ln will devour your flocks and your herds; They*ln will devour your vines and your fig trees; They*ln will demolish with the sword your fortified cities in which you trust.
“Yet*p even in those days,” declares the Lord,*s “I will not make you a complete destruction.

It shall come about when they say, ‘Why has the Lord*s our God done all these things to us?’ then you shall say to them, ‘As you have forsaken Me and served foreign gods in your land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours.’
“Declare*pn this in the house of Jacob And*ln proclaim it in Judah, saying,
‘Now*ln hear this, O foolish and senseless people, Who*ln have eyes but do not see; Who*ln have ears but do not hear.

Do*ln you not fear Me?’ declares the Lord.*s ‘Do*ln you not tremble in My presence? For*ln I have placed the sand as a boundary for the sea, An*ln eternal decree, so it cannot cross over it. Though*ln the waves toss, yet they cannot prevail; Though*ln they roar, yet they cannot cross over it.
But*ln this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart; They*ln have turned aside and departed.

They*ln do not say in their heart, “Let*ln us now fear the Lord*s our God, Who*ln gives rain in its season, Both*ln the autumn rain and the spring rain, Who*ln keeps for us The*ln appointed weeks of the harvest.”
Your*ln iniquities have turned these away, And*ln your sins have withheld good from you.
For*ln wicked men are found among My people, They*ln watch like fowlers lying in wait; They*ln set a trap, They*ln catch men.
Like*ln a cage full of birds, So*ln their houses are full of deceit; Therefore*ln they have become great and rich.

They*ln are fat, they are sleek, They*ln also excel in deeds of wickedness; They*ln do not plead the cause, The*ln cause of the orphan, that they may prosper; And*ln they do not defend the rights of the poor.
Shall*ln I not punish these people?’*i declares the Lord,*s ‘On*ln a nation such as this Shall*ln I not avenge Myself?’
“An*ln appalling and horrible thing Has*ln happened in the land:
The*ln prophets prophesy falsely, And*ln the priests rule on their own*i authority; And*ln My people love it so! But*ln what will you do at the end of it?
